channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Prosecutors Seek to Bar Trump From Attacking F.B.I. Agents in Documents Case
item.description: The prosecutors said the former president had made “grossly misleading” assertions about the F.B.I.’s search of Mar-a-Lago that could endanger the agents involved.

item.title: Hundreds Feared Dead in Papua New Guinea Landslide
item.description: Nearly 4,000 people live in villages that were engulfed, a local official said. Unstable debris was complicating search and rescue efforts in a rural part of the Pacific nation.

item.title: Meet the 102-year-old healthy-living pioneer who was espousing ‘wellness’ long before it was a trend
item.description: The founder of the famed Rancho la Puerta resort says that not worrying is more important than what kind of water you drink.

item.title: Xi Jinping’s Recipe for Total Control: An Army of Eyes and Ears
item.description: Reviving a Mao-era surveillance campaign, the authorities are tracking residents, schoolchildren and businesses to forestall any potential unrest.

item.title: Xi Jinping’s Recipe for Total Control: An Army of Eyes and Ears
item.description: Reviving a Mao-era surveillance campaign, the authorities are tracking residents, schoolchildren and businesses to forestall any potential unrest.

item.title: Families of slain Uvalde victims sue Meta, 'Call of Duty' maker, and gun manufacturer: 'This three-headed monster knowingly exposed him to the weapon'
item.description: “There is a direct line between the conduct of these companies and the Uvalde shooting,” said Josh Koskoff, an attorney for the families.

item.title: Sometimes U.S. and U.K. Politics Seem in Lock Step. Not This Year.
item.description: In 2016, Britain voted for Brexit and America for Trump, heralding a populist wave. Both countries face pivotal elections this year — but their paths appear to have diverged.

item.title: Sometimes U.S. and U.K. Politics Seem in Lock Step. Not This Year.
item.description: In 2016, Britain voted for Brexit and America for Trump, heralding a populist wave. Both countries face pivotal elections this year — but their paths appear to have diverged.

item.title: A law firm tried to blame a 9-year-old girl for not noticing an iPhone camera a former American Airlines flight attendant secretly taped to a toilet seat
item.description: A former American Airlines attendant is accused of luring girls to use the lavatory after taping his iPhone to the toilet seat and explaining that the seat was broken.

item.title: N.C.A.A. Athletes’ Pay Deal Raises Questions About Future of College Sports
item.description: The landmark settlement made many wonder what the reality — and impact — of revenue-sharing plans with college athletes would look like.

item.title: Barcelona’s Success Transforms the City Into the Women’s Soccer Capital
item.description: The success of Barcelona’s team has made Catalonia a laboratory for finding out what happens when the women’s game has prominence similar to the men’s.

item.title: CEO at $14 billion electronics firm can’t talk about his resignation following an internal investigation
item.description: The former exec can only say “no comment” in response to queries, according to restrictive covenants with an unusual provision.

item.title: El Califa de León: la primera taquería con una estrella Michelin
item.description: Este popular puesto de tacos en Ciudad de México ha duplicado sus ventas y tiene a turistas fotografiando su parrilla desde su mención en la prestigiosa guía gastronómica.

item.title: Top U.N. Court Decision Adds to Israel’s Growing Isolation
item.description: An order to stop the Rafah offensive was the latest action against Israel, all of which create “a tremendous sense of pressure,” a former consul general said.

item.title: Front-end developers: These are the states where you’ll find the highest average salaries
item.description: Front-end developers work on the visual aspect of websites, and can earn relatively high annual salaries. The states where they’re paid the most, though, may surprise you.
